review: Got this to go with my LG 47" SmartTV I ordered at the same time. The tv has built in internet browser but doesn't play flash videos. Based off those reviews, I ordered this with it to solve that problem. Everything installed properly and got to working with my wireless routher (linksys with "g" band, older model). Tried off my laptop (no bells or whistles and running internet on Wifi), that didn't go well. It would cast but too much lag time. Tried it off my desktop (also no bells or whistles but hard wired into the internet connection) and it run very smoothly. As I type this, I'm "casting" Nfl redzone onto my tv with no problems whatsoever. You will need to install and run off of Google chome browser for this to work. In addition, add on the chromecast extension and install the chromecast app when you receive the product. Very easy setup.

review: OK, My wife got me this form my birthday. I was all excited. No more would I need to hard wire my laptop to the TV to play videos.Unfortunately, the only video you can stream comes from the internet (e.g. Hulu, YouTube, Netflix, Pandora, etc...). Both my TV and Blu-Ray can already stream from these sources with built in apps. So the only people who need the chromecast are those who have older HDTVs or blu-ray players without this capability.That said, if you don't like the user interface on your TV for these apps, it may be worth it for you. YouTube being the biggest pain to use via your TV remote. However, we don't usually sit and watch YouTube on the TV. YouTube is usually used individually on laptops or iPads in our house and we don't need to stream it for all to see. However, I can always search and then cue up the netflix video via my laptop and then watch it on my TV by going to my instant queue. My TV remote does a nice job of controlling the netflix video. So again, no need for the chromecast.So the device is pretty useless for me. The advertising makes it seem like you can stream from your device to chromecast. But in reality, all you are doing is telling chromecast to go out to the internet and stream video from youtube, netflix, etc. NOT from your device (PC, iPad, Phone, etc...)Very misleading advertising on this google. I'm pretty disappointed.
author: C. Schneider
